page.title: 08Religion
page.content: Stubbington Churches. The Old Church of Holy Rood. This is Situated off Titchfield Road but has unfortunately been masked by a small new housing development so it cannot be seen from the main road.The original church built in the late 9th Century is refered to in the Doomsday Book of 1087. Services are only held there once a month,8 o'clock communion.It is often used for Weddings and other special services. Holy Rood Church. This is situated on Gosport Road.It was built in 1874 and in 1893 the tower was added.It is the main Church of England Church in the area with many activities for both young and old.Church House is the property of the church.Rev.John Maybury is the present vicar.
